questiontext.text: A nurse is administering IV vancomycin to a patient. Twenty minutes into the infusion, the patient develops a diffuse erythematous rash on the face, neck, and upper torso, accompanied by hypotension with BP 90/50 mmHg. What is the priority nursing action?

answer.text: Stop the medication immediately and notify the physician
Continue administration at a slower rate and monitor vital signs
Administer diphenhydramine as prescribed and continue the infusion
Document the reaction and complete the scheduled dose
